alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 5:40PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding is expected to persist due to heavy rain that fell earlier. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways and overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may remain impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain already ended. However, urban, arroyo, and small stream flooding are expected to linger. Between 0.25 and 2.5 inches of rain fell during mid-to-late afternoon resulting in flash flooding. - Hazardous water levels are expected to linger in the following streams and drainages... Ruidoso, Rio, Cedar Creek, North Fork Cedar Creek and Eagle Creek from Ruidoso and the McBride Burn Scar downstream to Glencoe. The Emergency Manager reported the Rio Ruidoso is bank full at Biscuit Hill. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
